poem:
**Echoes in the Dawn**

Labour is fair game;  
in the thin dawn,  
words sharpen like scythes,  
cutting through promises  
as brittle as the frost.

Led By Donkeys bray  
in Parliament's hollow  
corridors, their echo  
the conscience of those  
who forgot the field  
where truth once sowed.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Labour is fair game’: Led By Donkeys says it will hold government to account The satirical artists’ collective Led By Donkeys says the Labour government is “fair game” and it is inconceivable that the group will not hold it accountable over the next few years. “We’re not starry-eyed about Labour,” said Ben Stewart, one of the group’s founder members, after it made headlines this week when it targeted Liz Truss. Truss was in the middle". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
